thread.title: New 'Zelda: Breath of the Wild' Trailer Shows Off New Areas, Confirming It Won't Take Place in One Giant Field
thread.title_full: New 'Zelda: Breath of the Wild' Trailer Shows Off New Areas, Confirming It Won't Take Place in One Giant Field

author: Anonymous
title: New 'Zelda: Breath of the Wild' Trailer Shows Off New Areas, Confirming It Won't Take Place in One Giant Field
text:
Tweet Posted: Wed, 2/8/2017 - 5:27pm by Mikey McCollor 
Look, no one has been more excited for longer about The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild than us, but let's be honest — that game's been looking like it takes place in a damn field . Every trailer, every gameplay demo, every Jimmy Fallon appearance — they all found Link just runnin' around in a big empty field. Field, field, field. Were we Zelda fans waiting years and years for Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Field ? 
Press A to till. (source) 
But this new trailer, released today on the game's Japanese website and thrown up on YouTube by Gematsu , shows that Breath of the Wild will NOT be a farming sim. It will instead feature many different locales, including a rain world, a fire village, a snow zone, and a ball pit. Okay, there's no ball pit, but like, there should be. Link works too hard not to have any fun :) (source) 
Guys, we're less than a month away from this game. Can you believe it? In just over three weeks, we're going to be playing a new open-world Zelda game on a new Nintendo portable console . That means I'm going to be looking for Heart Containers in the backseat of an Uber . And let me tell you, that's the reason I was so worried it looked like Breath of the Wild was just going to be in a field — my commute is boring . 
I'd prefer Gannon just set the whole thing to flame.
